title: Sri Lanka schedules 4-hour power cuts for April 11, 12; 2h for April 16, 17
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Power cuts of up to 4 hours have been approved in Sri Lanka for April 11 and April 12, while 2 hour and 15 minutes for April 16 and 17, Public Utilities Commission Chairman Janaka Ratnayake said as severe foreign exchange shortages to import fuel were temporarily eased with fuel on borrowed money from India.
PUCSL said there will be no power shedding from April 13- April 15 due to the traditional Sinhala and Tamil New year.

On April 11 and April 12, areas A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, P, Q, R, S, T, U, V and W will have power cuts of 2 hours and 15 minutes from 8.30 pm to 5.30 pm and one hour and 45 minutes from 5.30 pm to 10.45 pm.

On April 16 and April 17, areas A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, P, Q, R, S, T, U, V and W will have power cuts of 2 hours and 15 minutes from 9.00 am to 6. 00 pm. There is no power cut scheduled in the nights during these two days.
Download the power cut schedule from here:Power-Interruption-Schedule April 11-15, Power-Interruption-Schedule, April 16, 17
Sri Lanka’s electricity demand had risen amid power cuts with more people using electricity for cooking and a delay in raising prices. (Colombo/April 10/2022)
